DataElement.preferredDefinition: A functional unit of heredity which occupies a specific position (locus) on a particular chromosome, is capable of reproducing itself exactly at each cell division, and directs the formation of an enzyme or other protein. The gene as a functional unit consists of a discrete segment of a giant DNA molecule containing the purine (adenine and guanine) and pyrimidine (cytosine and thymine) bases in the ordered and correct sequence that encodes a specific functional product (i.e., a protein or RNA molecule). Protein synthesis is mediated by molecules of messenger-RNA formed on the chromosome with the gene acting as template. The RNA then passes into the cytoplasm and becomes oriented on the ribosomes where it in turn acts as template to organize a chain of amino acids to form a peptide. Genes normally occur in pairs in all cells except gametes, as a consequence of the fact that all chromosomes are paired except the sex chromosomes (X and Y) of the male._A collection of facts from which conclusions may be drawn._The act of gathering something together._Generic value domain for a java datatype that is a class that represents character strings.

The gene as a functional unit consists of a discrete segment of a giant DNA molecule containing the purine (adenine and guanine) and pyrimidine (cytosine and thymine) bases in the ordered and correct sequence that encodes a specific functional product (i.e., a protein or RNA molecule). Protein synthesis is mediated by molecules of messenger-RNA formed on the chromosome with the gene acting as template. The RNA then passes into the cytoplasm and becomes oriented on the ribosomes where it in turn acts as template to organize a chain of amino acids to form a peptide. Genes normally occur in pairs in all cells except gametes, as a consequence of the fact that all chromosomes are paired except the sex chromosomes (X and Y) of the male._A collection of facts from which conclusions may be drawn._The act of gathering something together.

Concepts.definition: A functional unit of heredity which occupies a specific position on a particular chromosome and serves as the template for a product that contributes to a phenotype or a biological function.

Property.preferredDefinition: A collection of facts from which conclusions may be drawn.:The act of gathering something together.

Concepts.definition: A collection or single item of factual information, derived from measurement or research, from which conclusions may be drawn.
The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Text; the words of something written.
